title: Southall Travel reports 30% bookings boost
text:
Southall Travel reports 30% bookings boost 20 August 2015 Save 
Long-haul specialists Southall Travel has reported a 30% boost in bookings this year compared to last. 
March saw the biggest growth in bookings at 37% while June also proved strong, ahead 25% year on year. 
Dubai proved to be the most popular destination having grown 28% while Thailand came in second following a 16% boost. 
Maldives came third with 4% growth while the US took the fourth spot of the back of 52% growth. India came fifth following a 41% boost. 
Nearly half of those going so far overseas, 48%, opted for bed and breakfast accommodation with only one in 10 choosing all-inclusive. 
Kuljinder Bahia, managing director at Southall Travel, said: “Our bookings show that 2015 is set to be a bumper year for long-haul holidays with many of our destinations outselling previous years. 
“The research also suggests that British holidaymakers are becoming more adventurous with their travels and are looking to explore new destinations outside of Europe.”
